details.description: If there is a need for a new school in your area, you can set up a free school - find out what you need to do and how to increase your chance of success
details.body:
To set up a free school, youâ€™ll need to apply through the Department for Education website.

You can set up a free school as part of a group that can provide evidence of parental demand (eg a petition), such as:

  • community or faith groups
  • parents
  • teachers
  • charities
  • businesses
  • universities
  • independent schools (private, fee-paying schools)

All applications to set up a free school must be approved by the Secretary of State for the Department for Education. Free schools must:

  • meet a genuine need in the community, backed up by evidence
  • have a good financial plan in place
  • have ‘fair and transparent’ admission criteria

The Department for Education website has information about how to apply, as well as all the forms you need to complete.

The charity New Schools Network has a lot of information for people interested in setting up a free school.
